page.title: 05UNUSED HOUSES
page.content: {The East side of Braintree has a variety of housing stock. Two particular housing styles stand apart. Both were commissioned by families who had important industrial interests in Braintree. The older houses were built by the Courtauld family. They have a distinctive style which can be found in other parts of Braintree and North Essex.They are imposing solid houses of red brick, exposed timber facades and narrow leaded light windows. The newer houses were built by the Crittal family. Their striking features are their flat top roofs, angular streamlined facads and, uniformity. They were built along the lines of industrial housing where the house is made in parts offsite.
